results.title: Taiwan; South Korea
results.creator_credit: David Rabinovitch, Richard Carey, Fumihiko Ninomiya, Leo Eaton, Film Australia and Nihon Hoso Kyokai
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mini Dragons”.
Although Taiwan is in many ways an exemplary example of an Asian country which has boomed economically whilst diminishing the gap between the rich and the poor, it suffers from political power being held undemocratically by the ruling KMT party, a historical legacy, uncontrolled pollution and the influence of Japan. South Korea, on the other hand, has the largest gap between the rich and poor causing political unrest and violent protest, which along with increased competition from other rising economic powers in Asia may end South Korea’s era of economic success.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Rabinovitch, Richard Carey, Fumihiko Ninomiya, Leo Eaton, Film Australia and Nihon Hoso Kyokai

South Korea, on the other hand, has the largest gap between the rich and poor causing political unrest and violent protest, which along with increased competition from other rising economic powers in Asia may end South Korea’s era of economic success.

results.title: Vision of Galileo
results.creator_credit: Italo Costa and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Visits the cities in which Galileo lived and worked: Pisa, Florence, Padua, Venice and Rome. Also repeats some of his experiments and explains them in a script based largely on Galileo’s own writings. With David Suzuki. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Out of the mouths of babes
results.creator_credit: Heather Cook and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Focuses on Peter and Jill de Villiers, two Harvard researchers, and their contention that knowledge of a language is innate in humans and develops as the child matures biologically. Includes interviews with both scientists and highlights their work. Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: The Joy of effort
results.creator_credit: Roman Bittman and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Shows how the adaptation of a scientific approach to different spheres of human movement is becoming increasingly important in improving performances. Shows testing and measuring different areas of fitness, for example a runner, skater, and a gymnast.

results.title: Sleep
results.creator_credit: Heather Cook and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
We spend a third of our lives asleep. This program looks at the structure of sleep and disturbances to that structure, such as nightmares and sleepwalking, sleep disorders such as narcolepsy and what happens when our normal daily patterns of sleep and wakefulness, day and night are interrupted.
results.description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
